paper_metadata.title: Experimental characterization of energy consumption in 5-axis milling machine and developing optimization strategy

machine_info.machine_name: GF AgieCharmilles Mikron HPM 800U HD 5-axis High Performance Machining Center

tool_info.tool_type: MULTI-MASTER solid carbide head tool from ISCAR

energy_data.measurement_method: Split core clamp-on power probes (10mA to 100A range) + NI-DAQ simultaneous sampling card and NI-9215 for acquisition

kpi_metrics.efficiency_observation: SEC is inversely proportional to MRR. Higher MRR leads to lower SEC.
kpi_metrics.auxiliary_systems_contribution: 75.6% of total energy consumed by auxiliary systems
kpi_metrics.chip_conveyor_optimization_potential: Up to 90% energy reduction possible with duty cycle implementation

additional_notes: Study highlights the significant contribution of auxiliary systems to total energy consumption. Optimization strategies include duty cycle implementation for chip conveyor and smart scheduling for machine state management. RSM used for parameter optimization. Machine-specific characteristics important for energy consumption analysis.
